metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17094 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
wp-includes/feed.php in WordPress before 4.9.1 does not properly restrictenclosures in RSS and Atom fields, which might allow attackers to conductXSS attacks via a crafted URL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17094` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 4.9.5+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.9.5+dfsg1-1').
